# Arpeggio: Minor 7b5 in F (Shape: D)

---

## Brief Presentation
This arpeggio is a Minor 7 flat 5 arpeggio in the key of F, played using the 'D shape' on the guitar. It consists of the notes F, Ab, C, and Eb. This arpeggio is commonly used in jazz and fusion styles of music to add color and tension to chord progressions.

---

## Notes and Intervals
- F (Root)
- Ab (Minor 3rd)
- C (Diminished 5th)
- Eb (Minor 7th)

The intervals in this arpeggio create a dissonant, mysterious sound due to the flat 5th interval, adding tension to the minor tonality.

---

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Minor 7 flat 5 arpeggio in F (Shape: D) is often used in jazz, fusion, and other genres that incorporate complex harmonies and improvisation. When played, this arpeggio adds a sense of tension and intrigue to the music. It can be used to create a darker, more complex atmosphere within a piece, contrasting with more traditional minor or major sounds.

---
